content.raw: Oops. This pulls all the other changes from default back to gazebo7 as well. To just target your changes to gazebo7 you can create a branch off of gazebo7 and then apply (only) your changes to it.

content.raw:
Something like this may work:

~~~
hg up connection_send_message_once
hg diff -r default > ~/pr.diff
hg up gazebo7
hg branch send_once_gazebo7
hg import ~/pr.diff
~~~

Then target `send_once_gazebo7` to `gazebo7` in this PR
content.html:
Something like this may work:

hg up connection_send_message_once
hg diff -r default > ~/pr.diff
hg up gazebo7
hg branch send_once_gazebo7
hg import ~/pr.diff

Then target send_once_gazebo7 to gazebo7 in this PR

content.raw: Thanks for elaborating. For some reason I thought `ThreadedMultiPubSub` only had one subscriber, but looking  at it again I see it has two. So it should print  one message with the change and two without as observed.
content.html: Thanks for elaborating. For some reason I thought ThreadedMultiPubSub only had one subscriber, but looking at it again I see it has two. So it should print one message with the change and two without as observed.

pull_request.title: Send message to subscribers only once per connection

pullrequest.title: Send message to subscribers only once per connection

content.raw: The reason `ThreadedMultiPubSub` prints only one message is that once the first publisher has been declared, the topic is considered to be locally advertised and when the second call to `TopicManager::Advertise` is done, `Publication::GetLocallyAdvertised` returns `true` which leads to `ConnectionManager::Advertise` not being called. This pull request does not affect this behavior.
content.html: The reason ThreadedMultiPubSub prints only one message is that once the first publisher has been declared, the topic is considered to be locally advertised and when the second call to TopicManager::Advertise is done, Publication::GetLocallyAdvertised returns true which leads to ConnectionManager::Advertise not being called. This pull request does not affect this behavior.

content.raw: Sorry for the late reply. With the same change, you can also launch `gzserver` and, in another terminal, `gz model -m ground_plane -i`. Without the change, the message `Advertisement on /gazebo/default/request` will be printed four times instead of one.
content.html: Sorry for the late reply. With the same change, you can also launch gzserver and, in another terminal, gz model -m ground_plane -i. Without the change, the message Advertisement on /gazebo/default/request will be printed four times instead of one.

content.html:
If you make the following change and then run test::integration::transport.cc you will see "Advertisement on /gazebo/default/test" printed once for ThreadedSinglePubSub and twice for ThreadedMultiSubSinglePub even though both have only a single publisher.

diff -r 40c062da7dcc gazebo/transport/ConnectionManager.cc
--- a/gazebo/transport/ConnectionManager.cc Tue Jul 25 14:09:17 2017 -0700
+++ b/gazebo/transport/ConnectionManager.cc Mon Jul 31 15:01:19 2017 -0700
@@ -403,6 +403,7 @@
   {
     msgs::Publish pub;
     pub.ParseFromString(packet.serialized_data());
+    std::cerr << "Advertisement on " << pub.topic() << "\n";
     if (pub.host() != this->serverConn->GetLocalAddress() ||
         pub.port() != this->serverConn->GetLocalPort())
     {
